item.title: Forecasting: principles and practice (UWA course)
item.description: Workshop to be held on 23-25 September 2014. Venue: The University Club, University of Western Australia, Nedlands WA. item.title: Book Review of "Data Analysis and Graphics Using R: An Example-based Approach" (Maindonald and Braun, 2003)
Using R to Teach Econometrics
item.description: R, an open-source programming environment for data analysis and graphics, has in only a decade grown to become a de-facto standard for statistical analysis against which many popular commercial programs may be measured. The use of R for the teaching of econometric methods is appealing. It provides cutting-edge statistical methods which are, by R’s open-source nature, available immediately. The software is stable, available at no cost, and exists for a number of platforms, including various flavors of Unix and Linux, Windows (9x/NT/2000), and the MacOS.
